philjs-forms

View source

Form handling primitives with validation, error handling, and server actions support.

Functions

Creates a form controller with validation, submission handling, and field management.

function createForm<T>(options: FormOptions<T>): FormReturn<T>

Parameters

optionsFormOptions<T>Configuration object for the form

Returns

FormReturn<T>Form controller with fields, handlers, and state

Example

1const form = createForm({
2  initialValues: {
3    email: '',
4    password: '',
5  },
6  validate: (values) => {
7    const errors: Record<string, string> = {};
8    if (!values.email) errors.email = 'Required';
9    if (!values.email.includes('@')) errors.email = 'Invalid email';
10    if (values.password.length < 8) errors.password = 'Too short';
11    return errors;
12  },
13  onSubmit: async (values) => {
14    await signIn(values);
15  },
16});
17 
18// In your component
19<form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit}>
20  <input {...form.field('email')} />
21  {form.errors.email && <span>{form.errors.email}</span>}
22 
23  <input type="password" {...form.field('password')} />
24  {form.errors.password && <span>{form.errors.password}</span>}
25 
26  <button type="submit" disabled={form.submitting}>
27    Submit
28  </button>
29</form>

Hook version of createForm for use within components.

function useForm<T>(options: FormOptions<T>): FormReturn<T>

Parameters

optionsFormOptions<T>Configuration object for the form

Returns

FormReturn<T>Form controller with fields, handlers, and state

Example

1function LoginForm() {
2  const form = useForm({
3    initialValues: { email: '', password: '' },
4    onSubmit: async (values) => {
5      await login(values);
6    },
7  });
8 
9  return (
10    <form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit}>
11      <input {...form.field('email')} />
12      <input type="password" {...form.field('password')} />
13      <button type="submit">Login</button>
14    </form>
15  );
16}

Creates an individual form field with its own validation and state.

function createFormField<T>(name: string, options?: FieldOptions<T>): FormField<T>

Parameters

namestringField name for form data
options?FieldOptions<T>Field configuration

Returns

FormField<T>Field controller with value, error, and handlers

Example

1const emailField = createFormField('email', {
2  validate: (value) => {
3    if (!value) return 'Email is required';
4    if (!value.includes('@')) return 'Invalid email';
5  },
6  transform: (value) => value.toLowerCase().trim(),
7});
8 
9<input
10  value={emailField.value()}
11  onInput={(e) => emailField.setValue(e.target.value)}
12  onBlur={emailField.handleBlur}
13/>
14{emailField.touched() && emailField.error() && (
15  <span>{emailField.error()}</span>
16)}

Wraps a server action with pending state and error handling.

function useServerAction<T, R>(action: (data: T) => Promise<R>): ServerActionReturn<T, R>

Parameters

action(data: T) => Promise<R>Server action function

Returns

ServerActionReturn<T, R>Action wrapper with execute, pending, and error state

Example

1// server/actions.ts
2'use server';
3export async function createUser(data: UserData) {
4  return db.users.create({ data });
5}
6 
7// Component
8import { createUser } from './server/actions';
9 
10function CreateUserForm() {
11  const { execute, pending, error, data } = useServerAction(createUser);
12 
13  return (
14    <form action={execute}>
15      <input name="name" />
16      <input name="email" type="email" />
17      {pending() && <Spinner />}
18      {error() && <Alert>{error().message}</Alert>}
19      <button type="submit">Create</button>
20    </form>
21  );
22}

Creates a reusable validator from a schema definition.

function createValidator<T>(schema: ValidationSchema<T>): Validator<T>

Parameters

schemaValidationSchema<T>Validation schema object

Returns

Validator<T>Validator function

Example

1const userValidator = createValidator({
2  email: {
3    required: 'Email is required',
4    pattern: [/^[^@]+@[^@]+$/, 'Invalid email format'],
5  },
6  password: {
7    required: 'Password is required',
8    minLength: [8, 'Password must be at least 8 characters'],
9    custom: (value) => {
10      if (!/[A-Z]/.test(value)) {
11        return 'Must contain uppercase letter';
12      }
13    },
14  },
15  age: {
16    min: [18, 'Must be 18 or older'],
17    max: [120, 'Invalid age'],
18  },
19});
20 
21const form = createForm({
22  validate: userValidator,
23  // ...
24});

Provides form context to child components for nested form fields.

function FormProvider<T>(props: { form: FormReturn<T>; children: JSX.Element }): JSX.Element

Parameters

formFormReturn<T>Form controller instance
childrenJSX.ElementChild components

Example

1function CheckoutForm() {
2  const form = createForm({ /* ... */ });
3 
4  return (
5    <FormProvider form={form}>
6      <form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit}>
7        <ShippingFields />
8        <PaymentFields />
9        <button type="submit">Complete Order</button>
10      </form>
11    </FormProvider>
12  );
13}
14 
15function ShippingFields() {
16  const form = useFormContext();
17  return (
18    <>
19      <input {...form.field('address')} />
20      <input {...form.field('city')} />
21    </>
22  );
23}

Types

Configuration options for createForm and useForm.

Properties

PropertyTypeDescription
initialValuesTInitial form values
validate?(values: T) => Record<string, string>Validation function
onSubmit(values: T) => void | Promise<void>Submit handler
validateOnChange?booleanValidate on every change(default: false)
validateOnBlur?booleanValidate on field blur(default: true)

Return value of createForm with all form controls.

Properties

PropertyTypeDescription
valuesAccessor<T>Current form values
errorsRecord<keyof T, string>Current validation errors
touchedRecord<keyof T, boolean>Fields that have been touched
submittingAccessor<boolean>Whether form is submitting
field(name: keyof T) => FieldPropsGet props for a field
handleSubmit(e: Event) => voidForm submit handler
reset() => voidReset form to initial values
setFieldValue(name: keyof T, value: any) => voidSet a field value programmatically

Schema definition for createValidator.

Example

1type ValidationSchema<T> = {
2  [K in keyof T]?: {
3    required?: string | boolean;
4    minLength?: [number, string];
5    maxLength?: [number, string];
6    min?: [number, string];
7    max?: [number, string];
8    pattern?: [RegExp, string];
9    custom?: (value: T[K], values: T) => string | undefined;
10  };
11};
